spec.name: fallacies
spec.notes: Core fallacy drivers for blind spot tagging. Each item has id, label, and 1-line definition.

fallacies.label: False Dilemma
fallacies.definition: Forcing a choice between limited options when more exist.

fallacies.label: Appeal to Authority
fallacies.definition: Claiming something is true because an authority says so.

fallacies.label: Circular Reasoning
fallacies.definition: Using the conclusion as evidence for itself.

fallacies.label: Cherry Picking
fallacies.definition: Highlighting only favorable data while ignoring the rest.

fallacies.label: Hasty Generalization
fallacies.definition: Drawing a broad rule from too few examples.

fallacies.label: Ad Hominem
fallacies.definition: Attacking the person instead of their argument.

fallacies.label: Slippery Slope
fallacies.definition: Arguing one step will inevitably trigger extreme outcomes.

fallacies.label: Post Hoc
fallacies.definition: Assuming causation just because one event followed another.

fallacies.label: Straw Man
fallacies.definition: Misrepresenting someone’s argument to make it easier to attack.

fallacies.label: Appeal to Emotion
fallacies.definition: Substituting feelings for valid reasoning.

fallacies.label: Bandwagon
fallacies.definition: Assuming something is true because many believe it.

fallacies.label: Red Herring
fallacies.definition: Introducing irrelevant info to distract from the issue.

fallacies.label: False Cause
fallacies.definition: Mistaking correlation for causation.

fallacies.label: Equivocation
fallacies.definition: Using the same word in different senses to mislead.

fallacies.label: Appeal to Tradition
fallacies.definition: Claiming something is correct because it’s long-standing.

fallacies.label: Appeal to Nature
fallacies.definition: Arguing something is good because it’s natural.

fallacies.label: False Analogy
fallacies.definition: Drawing a comparison between unlike things as proof.

fallacies.label: Burden of Proof
fallacies.definition: Demanding others disprove a claim rather than proving it.

fallacies.label: No True Scotsman
fallacies.definition: Rejecting counterexamples by changing the group definition.

fallacies.label: Appeal to Ignorance
fallacies.definition: Arguing something is true because it hasn’t been proven false.
